title: Steve Daines
added: Sedition - On January 2nd 2020, senator Dains joined a group of 11 other senators in a seditious attemp to overturn the lawful election of President Elect Joe Biden.  The treasonus group is led by Senator Ted Cruz of Texas and includes Senators Ron Johnson of Wisconsin, James Lankford of Oklahoma, Steve Daines of Montana, John Kennedy of Louisiana, Marsha Blackburn of Tennessee and Mike Braun of Indiana, and Senators-elect Cynthia Lummis of Wyoming, Roger Marshall of Kansas, Bill Hagerty of Tennessee and Tommy Tuberville of Alabama.

The treasonus group is led by Senator Ted Cruz of Texas and includes Senators Ron Johnson of Wisconsin, James Lankford of Oklahoma, Steve Daines of Montana, John Kennedy of Louisiana, Marsha Blackburn of Tennessee and Mike Braun of Indiana, and Senators-elect Cynthia Lummis of Wyoming, Roger Marshall of Kansas, Bill Hagerty of Tennessee and Tommy Tuberville of Alabama.

title: Steve Daines
deleted: In June 2020, amid [[George Floyd protests|protests]] against racism and police brutality in the wake of [[Killing of George Floyd|George Floyd's death]], Daines defended Trump's decision to disperse protestors with a chemical irritant so that he could stage a [[Donald Trump photo-op at St. John's Church|photo op in front of St. John's Church]], saying he was "grateful for the president's leadership".<ref>{{Cite web|title=Senate Republicans struggle to respond to Trump's actions on protests|first1=Leigh Ann|last1=Caldwell|first2=Kasie|last2=Hunt|first3=Julie|last3=Tsirkin|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/congress/senate-republicans-struggle-respond-trump-s-actions-protests-n1222726|date=June 3, 2020|access-date=2020-06-04|website=NBC News|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Panetta|first=Grace|title='I don't know. I wasn't there': Most GOP Senators decline to condemn law enforcement tear-gassing protesters for Trump's church photo op|url=https://www.businessinsider.com/gop-senators-are-overwhelmingly-silent-on-trump-bible-photo-op-2020-6|date=June 2, 2020|access-date=2020-06-04|website=Business Insider}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Perano|first=Ursula|title=GOP senators scold Trump over St. John's photo op|url=https://www.axios.com/trump-st-johns-church-protests-tear-gas-floyd-5581d713-de49-4239-a99a-de28cc83a49c.html|date=June 2, 2020|access-date=2020-06-04|website=Axios|language=en}}</ref>

title: Steve Daines
added: In February 2021, while Texas was suffering power outages amid a snowstorm, Daines tweeted "This is a perfect example of the need for reliable energy sources like natural gas & coal," in a criticism of renewable energy such as wind turbines and solar energy. However, failures in natural gas, coal, and nuclear energy systems cause nearly twice as much power outages as frozen wind turbines and solar panels.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2021-02-17|title=Texas blackouts fuel false claims about renewable energy|url=https://apnews.com/article/false-claims-texas-blackout-wind-turbine-f9e24976e9723021bec21f9a68afe927|access-date=2021-02-17|website=AP NEWS}}</ref>
